speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: SCENE IV. The field of battle.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Alarum. Excursions. Enter PISTOL, French Soldier, and Boy

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Yield, cur!

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Je pense que vous etes gentilhomme de bonne qualite.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Qualtitie calmie custure me! Art thou a gentleman?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: what is thy name? discuss.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: O Seigneur Dieu!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: O, Signieur Dew should be a gentleman:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Perpend my words, O Signieur Dew, and mark;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: O Signieur Dew, thou diest on point of fox,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Except, O signieur, thou do give to me

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Egregious ransom.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: O, prenez misericorde! ayez pitie de moi!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Moy shall not serve; I will have forty moys;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Or I will fetch thy rim out at thy throat

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: In drops of crimson blood.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Est-il impossible d'echapper la force de ton bras?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Brass, cur!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Thou damned and luxurious mountain goat,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Offer'st me brass?

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: O pardonnez moi!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Say'st thou me so? is that a ton of moys?

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Come hither, boy: ask me this slave in French

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: What is his name.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Ecoutez: comment etes-vous appele?

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Monsieur le Fer.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: He says his name is Master Fer.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Master Fer! I'll fer him, and firk him, and ferret

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: him: discuss the same in French unto him.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: I do not know the French for fer, and ferret, and firk.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Bid him prepare; for I will cut his throat.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Que dit-il, monsieur?

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Il me commande de vous dire que vous faites vous

speaker: Boy
text_entry: pret; car ce soldat ici est dispose tout a cette

speaker: Boy
text_entry: heure de couper votre gorge.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Owy, cuppele gorge, permafoy,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Peasant, unless thou give me crowns, brave crowns;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Or mangled shalt thou be by this my sword.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: O, je vous supplie, pour l'amour de Dieu, me

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: pardonner! Je suis gentilhomme de bonne maison:

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: gardez ma vie, et je vous donnerai deux cents ecus.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: What are his words?

speaker: Boy
text_entry: He prays you to save his life: he is a gentleman of

speaker: Boy
text_entry: a good house; and for his ransom he will give you

speaker: Boy
text_entry: two hundred crowns.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Tell him my fury shall abate, and I the crowns will take.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Petit monsieur, que dit-il?

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Encore qu'il est contre son jurement de pardonner

speaker: Boy
text_entry: aucun prisonnier, neanmoins, pour les ecus que vous

speaker: Boy
text_entry: l'avez promis, il est content de vous donner la

speaker: Boy
text_entry: liberte, le franchisement.

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: Sur mes genoux je vous donne mille remercimens; et

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: je m'estime heureux que je suis tombe entre les

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: mains d'un chevalier, je pense, le plus brave,

speaker: French Soldier
text_entry: vaillant, et tres distingue seigneur d'Angleterre.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Expound unto me, boy.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: He gives you, upon his knees, a thousand thanks; and

speaker: Boy
text_entry: he esteems himself happy that he hath fallen into

speaker: Boy
text_entry: the hands of one, as he thinks, the most brave,

speaker: Boy
text_entry: valorous, and thrice-worthy signieur of England.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: As I suck blood, I will some mercy show.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Follow me!

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Suivez-vous le grand capitaine.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Exeunt PISTOL, and French Soldier

speaker: Boy
text_entry: I did never know so full a voice issue from so

speaker: Boy
text_entry: empty a heart: but the saying is true 'The empty

speaker: Boy
text_entry: vessel makes the greatest sound.' Bardolph and Nym

speaker: Boy
text_entry: had ten times more valour than this roaring devil i'

speaker: Boy
text_entry: the old play, that every one may pare his nails with

speaker: Boy
text_entry: a wooden dagger; and they are both hanged; and so

speaker: Boy
text_entry: would this be, if he durst steal any thing

speaker: Boy
text_entry: adventurously. I must stay with the lackeys, with

speaker: Boy
text_entry: the luggage of our camp: the French might have a

speaker: Boy
text_entry: good prey of us, if he knew of it; for there is

speaker: Boy
text_entry: none to guard it but boys.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Exit
